org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.tools

Class AbstractTool<VR>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.tools.AbstractTool<VR>
  • Type Parameters:
    VR - The visual root node of the UI toolkit used, e.g. javafx.scene.Node in case of JavaFX.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IActivatable, IAdaptable.Bound<IDomain<VR>>, ITool<VR>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FXClickDragTool, FXHoverTool, FXPinchSpreadTool, FXRotateTool, FXScrollTool, FXTypeTool

    public abstract class AbstractTool<VR>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ITool<VR>
    The AbstractTool can be used as a base class for ITool implementations.

      java.util.List<? extends IPolicy<VR>> getActivePolicies(IViewer<VR> viewer)
      Returns an (unmodifiable) list containing the interaction policies that are currently active within this tool for the given IViewer, i.e. the target policies of this tool that get notified about events within the given IViewer.

      Gets the value of the property adaptable.

      The IDomain, this ITool is adapted to.

      Gets the value of the property active.
      protected void registerListeners()
      This method is called when a valid IDomain is attached to this tool so that you can register event listeners for various inputs (keyboard, mouse) or model changes (selection, scroll offset / viewport).
      protected void setActivePolicies(IViewer<VR> viewer, java.util.Collection<? extends IPolicy<VR>> activePolicies)
      Set the active policies of this tool to the given policies.
      void setAdaptable(IDomain<VR> adaptable)
      Sets the value of the property adaptable.
      protected void unregisterListeners()
      This method is called when the attached IDomain is reset to null so that you can unregister previously registered event listeners.

        protected void clearActivePolicies(IViewer<VR> viewer)

      • getActivePolicies

        public java.util.List<? extends IPolicy<VR>> getActivePolicies(IViewer<VR> viewer)
        Description copied from interface: ITool
        Returns an (unmodifiable) list containing the interaction policies that are currently active within this tool for the given IViewer, i.e. the target policies of this tool that get notified about events within the given IViewer.
        Specified by:
        getActivePolicies in interface ITool<VR>
        Parameters:
        viewer - The IViewer for which to return the active policies.
        Returns:
        An (unmodifiable) list containing the interaction policies that are currently active within this tool.

      • registerListeners

        protected void registerListeners()
        This method is called when a valid IDomain is attached to this tool so that you can register event listeners for various inputs (keyboard, mouse) or model changes (selection, scroll offset / viewport).

      • setActivePolicies

        protected void setActivePolicies(IViewer<VR> viewer,
                                 java.util.Collection<? extends IPolicy<VR>> activePolicies)
        Set the active policies of this tool to the given policies.
        Parameters:
        viewer - The IViewer for which to store the active policies of this tool.
        activePolicies - The active policies of this tool.
        See Also:
        clearActivePolicies(IViewer), getActivePolicies(IViewer)

        protected void unregisterListeners()
